name: Dawson Pent

projects.title: Georgia Tech Research — Cetacean Enrichment AUV
projects.description: Bioacoustic Listening and Interactive Platform (BLIP) Google funded embedded system enabling wild dolphin communication

projects.title: Southern Company Internship — Environment Dashboard

projects.title: Handeye Coordinator — Haptic Navigation Case
projects.description: iPhone LiDAR + ESP32 haptic case for locomotion assistance for visually impaired users (Swift + Bluetooth + firmware).

projects.title: Synthesizer Learning Toy
projects.description: 3D-printed educational toy with capacitive touch, audio/visual/tactile feedback for accessibility-focused STEM lessons.

projects.title: OpenGL Chess — GPU & CPU Multithreading
projects.description: 3D chess renderer built in OpenGL with vertex-based object files and multithreaded rendering optimizations.

projects.title: VEX Robotics — Team Lead & Autonomous
projects.description: Team rebuilding, mentoring, and autonomous system development (C++, PID, odometry) — multiple awards across tournaments.

projects.description: Small apps & tooling (React / Flask / Python) to simplify workflows — PDF auto-fill, grocery planners, utilities.

aboutpara: Im a senior Computer Engineering student at Georgia Tech (Robotics/Automation & Distributed Systems/Software threads). I work across embedded firmware, hardware prototyping, controls, and full-stack interfaces — from TinyML on microcontrollers to React front-ends and Power BI dashboards. I'm an Eagle Scout, a research assistant on cetacean enrichment robotics, and I love building practical things that help people and researchers.

resume.tagline: Embedded systems • Controls • Robotics • Full-stack development
resume.description: Senior Computer Engineering student at Georgia Tech. I build embedded systems, robots, and user-centered software. I'm interested in controls, autonomous systems, firmware, and clean UI design — bridging hardware and software to deliver robust, testable solutions.

experiences.position: Infrastructure Intern — Southern Company Technology Organization
bullets: Supported ASCEND program migrating legacy mainframe systems to cloud infrastructure.
Built and deployed a large-scale Power BI dashboard for environment health monitoring and visualization.
Analyzed telemetry data and integrated Dynatrace monitoring to improve system observability.
Collaborated with cross-functional corporate teams, delivering technical presentations and reports.

experiences.position: College of Computing — Interactive Computing Animal Lab, Georgia Tech
bullets: Developing TinyML (LiteRT) firmware and custom circuitry for a dolphin-communication AUV funded by Google/DeepMind.
Integrated embedded systems, hydrophone sensors, and ROV control algorithms to enable whistle/click-based autonomous enrichment.
Built an ESP32 + Flask-based telemetry pipeline with Google Pixel GPU inference for whistle recognition and dashboard visualization.
Previously designed an enrichment robotic fish toy with the Georgia Aquarium to increase penguin engagement.

experiences.position: Team Lead & Programmer — VEX Robotics Competition
bullets: Rebuilt and mentored a robotics program as the sole returning member, training 9 students across 2 teams in engineering design and testing.
Achieved 7 awards across 6 tournaments, including 2 Excellence Awards for top overall team performance.
Programmed autonomous navigation in C++ using PID controllers and encoder-based odometry algorithms.
Directed QA testing and iterative improvements to prepare robots for tournament performance and professional judging.
